alert.note: Alert for Calloway; Graves; Marshall (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 1:31AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following counties, Calloway, Graves and Marshall. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated the heaviest rain had largely moved out of the area. However, water may be slow to recede in areas that received the heaviest rainfall. Observed rainfall was up to 4 inches in northwest Calloway and southwest Graves Counties, with a larger area of 2 to 3.5" straddling the Murray and Mayfield areas and across southern Marshall County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Murray, Mayfield, Benton, Lynnville, Sedalia, Wingo, Hardin, Hazel, Water Valley, Kirksey, Harris Grove, Brewers, New Concord and Aurora. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
